snippet: Ms. Clinton pressed the State Department to speed the release of emails from her time as secretary of state, shortly after a federal judge rejected the agency’s proposal to disseminate some of the emails by January.
abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton urges State Dept to quickly release 55,000 pages of emails from her tenure as secretary of state, coming just after federal Judge Rudolph Contreras rejected department's plan to disseminate some emails by 2016 and ordered 'rolling production' of records.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Clinton pressed the State Department to speed the release of emails from her time as secretary of state, shortly after a federal judge rejected the agency’s proposal to disseminate some of the emails by January.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Calls for Email Release After Agency Plan Is Rejected
headline.print_headline: Clinton Calls for Email Release After Agency Plan Is Rejected
